ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved a lot in Speaking, vocab and reading.
Greater knowledge of the German Language
Improved German reading, writing, and speaking skills. Learned more grammatical structures and vocabulary building on the experience from L1.

Language basics: vocabulary, grammar, reading/writing, speaking/listening.
The default language of instruction was German which definitely helped me to solidify my functional language skills versus translation from English. 
I also appreciated the emphasis on group work this semester.
I became more confident in my German even better than when I finished L1. I was also exposed to more parts of the German-speaking peoples culture-wise.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: a lot of practice, a lot interaction
Weakness: the pace is too fast.

Very well structured, material follows a logical progression. There is a lot of work in this course, with something due almost every day. I did not like the asynchronous days because they often were more work than being in class and I found I got less out of it than I would in class.

I liked the weekly structure with asynchronous work on Wednesdays. I also liked that there was less emphasis on work in the textbook compared to my German 110 course. I like Connect for homework, but it did get a bit tedious at times and sometimes the content wasn't used in class after.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, but it is a lot of work. If you want to learn German, the course is well organized and fast paced and feels like you learn a lot. However, it seems like a lot of work compared to other languages.
Yes! I think German 110 is a similar experience regardless of the professor but Prof Feng was great.
I would definitely recommend this course if you would like to improve your German. It is a lot of busy work, but at the end it is what helps you learn more.
Yes, if you're looking to improve your German!
YES! German is wonderful. This course is an excellent confidence-boost.
